reviewText: If you like superfriends, you already know why you are here.  You have Superman,Wonder Woman and of course Batman in these classic tales from the 1980's with great stories, plenty of action and a chance to see your favorite DC heroes like you remember them from your childhood.  The episodes where all the heroes got along, standing together to fight evil  minus the drama you see from today's comics and shows.  Great addition to any DC fan's dvd collection

reviewText: Like a lot of other people, I never thought that the short episodes would ever make it onto DVD. I've probably watched this DVD more than ten times by now! As many have noted, this season contains 8 half hour episodes. Each episode contains three separate 6 minute+ episodes which make up the 24 adventures advertised on the front of the DVD case. Nostalgic comic book fans may get a kick out of seeing an animated Fortress of Solitude. This iconic structure made it's Super Friends debut in 1979 but on this DVD of 1980 episodes it's referred to and seen several times. In "Journey into Blackness" it starts out with Superman, at the Fortress, studying the presence of a black hole that threatens to swallow the Earth. Then in the final episode on the DVD, "Revenge of Bizarro", after being exposed to red kryptonite (and growing extra arms and legs) Superman flies to the Fortress get the one thing that harms Bizarro: blue kryptonite.The Wonder Twins appear on several episodes, often in the second episode per half hour, in more socially aware episodes as well as episodes having to do with teenage peer pressure (much like their segments during the 1977 season). "Cycle Gang", for example, features the Twins having to fight off a bullish biker gang that ran a grandfather and his grandson off the road earlier in the episode. "The Ice Demon" has Clark Kent and Lois Lane at a ski resort doing research on a mysterious ice demon that Lois suspects is just one big hoax. The Twins are captured by the demon...Clark makes a hasty exit from Lois and changes into Superman. This may have been the first time in a Super Friends episode where Clark is visually shown changing into Superman. This was NOT the first appearance of Lois Lane in a Super Friends episode, though. The character had first appeared in 1978's "Superfriends: Rest in Peace" when both she and Perry White appeared at the Daily Planet. The two were being held hostage by Lex Luthor and Solomon Grundy. Lois also appeared in android/mannequin form in 1978's "The Rise and Fall of the Super Friends" where Mr. Mxyzptlk orchestrated a bizarre scenario of having the Super Friends act out his movie script. The scene called for Superman to marry Lois (she wore a memorable wedding ring!). This marked the first appearance of Mxyzptlk in a Super Friends episode.The 5th Dimensional villain makes an appearance in this season, too, in an episode titled "Mxyzptlk Strikes Again". In this episode, the imp uses a typewriter to dream up various roles for the Super Friends to portray...all for his own amusement. As with other episodes involving the villain, Superman tricks him back into the 5th Dimension. The Riddler makes an appearance on "Around the world in 80 Riddles" where he sprays several of the Super Friends with stupid spray and leaves them several riddles to solve...with every hour that goes by the gradual slip into hysterical nonsense takes shape as the stupid spray takes on it's full impact.The Twins take center stage in "The Rock and Roll Space Bandits", too. In this episode a rock band uses their high pitched music to hypnotize the citizens of Metropolis. The subject of time travel is explored in "Elevator to Nowhere". Wonder Woman and Atom are lured into a trap by a mad inventor and are initially sent to the year of 1776 and encounter George Washington during the Revolutionary War. A trip to 70,000,000 B.C. is also explored as the two search for the inventor. The Amazons of Paradise Island, as well as Rima, take center stage in "Return of Atlantis". Not to be confused with Aquaman's home, this episode refers to the ancient lost city...although Aquaman appears in the episode (abducted by a villainess named Ocina).Considering each episode features 3 short adventures it may come across to some as much more condensed. The beginning, middle, and end had to be told in 6 or 7 minutes which, of course, cut out a lot of time to do much more detailed storytelling. So, if you're much more familiar with the longer episodes, these ones may seem startling but then again, if you've got the Lost Episodes DVD of the Super Friends then you'll be greatly familiar with the format shown on this collection.

reviewText: After almost a 3 year wait since the last big release of Super Friends cartoons on DVD, (WOW! Has it really been 3 Years!?) the 1980-1981 season of 8 episodes (comprised of 24 seven minute shorts) finally makes its debut on DVD this July 23rd.Here's what you get.The 1980-1981 Shorts: (Please note that every 3 cartoons listed below make up one half hour episode)01) Bigfoot02) Ice Demon03) Makeup Monster04) Journey Into Blackness05) Cycle Gang06) Dive To Disaster07) Yuna The Terrible08) Rock And Roll Space Bandits09) Elevator To Nowhere10) One Small Step For Mars11) Haunted House12) The Incredible Crude Oil Monster13) The Voodoo Vampire14) Invasion Of The Gleeks15) Mxyzptlk Strikes Again16) The Man In The Moon17) Circus Of Horrors18) Around The World In 80 Riddles19) Termites From Venus20) Eruption21) Return Of Atlantis22) The Killer Machines23) Garden Of Doom24) Revenge Of Bizarro(1 disc) Total running time: Approximately 3 hoursThis is fantastic news for Super Friends fans every where who have been waiting very patiently for the rest of the Super Friends seasons to finally be released on DVD.  As many are already aware, the 1979 season, "World's Greatest Super Friends" is currently available exclusively at all TARGET stores across the country.  That leaves only Season 6 from 1981-1982, which was comprised of 18 seven minute shorts, left to be released on DVD.  (Update: WB has confirmed Season 6 will be out on DVD October 8th!  Special thanks to Robert J. Sublett for pointing this out in the 'comments' thread.)Order your copy of the 1980-81 Season on DVD today!COMPLETE SUPER FRIENDS DISCOGRAPHY BELOW:"Super Friends!" Vol. One&Vol. Two[Season 1] - Sixteen 46 Minute Episodes (1973)"The All-New Super Friends Hour" Vol. 1&Vol. 2[Season 2] - Fifteen 21 Minute Episodes & Forty-Five 7 Minute Shorts (1977)"Challenge of the Super Friends"[Season 3.1] - Sixteen 21 Minute Episodes (1978)"Super Friends": Volume Two[Season 3.2] - Sixteen 21 Minute Episodes [Aired along side 'Challenge] (1978)"The World's Greatest Super Friends!" [Season 4] - Eight 22 minute episodes - TARGET STORE EXCLUSIVE 4/23/13 (1979)"Super Friends" A Dangerous Fate [Season 5] - Twenty-Four 7 minute shorts (1980-81)"Super Friends": Legacy of Super Powers[Season 6] - Eighteen 7 minute shorts - AVAILABLE on DVD OCTOBER 8th! (1981-82)"Super Friends": The Lost Episodes[Season 7] - Twenty-Four 7 Minute Shorts (1983)"Super Friends: The Legendary Super Powers Show"[Season 8] - Sixteen 11 Minute Episodes (1984)"The Super Powers Team: Galactic Guardians"[Season 9] - Six 21 Minute Episodes & Four 11 Minute Episodes (1985)
summary: Super Friends Season of Cartoon Shorts from 1980-81 Are Finally Here!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This release can't come at a better time for DC Comics. If a comics and/or cartoon fan is looking to introduce a novice to the DC characters, I'd recommend the Super Friends. Today we look back at the animation of the 70s-80s and some may criticize for its one-dimensional presentation; however, TV standards and practices were different so as to insure children were not being 'corrupted' by Saturday morning cartoon fare. Nevertheless, if one wants a child of today to enjoy DC characters who aren't placed in gray areas of decision making, characters who fight evil without hesitation, and who help each other almost instantly, then the Super Friends are for you.
summary: The 1980-81 Superfriends shorts are finally hitting DVD!
